manifest.creator: Aaron Halfaker <aaron.halfaker@gmail.com>
manifest.comment: Init with my best understanding of the fields

researchObject.title: The English Wikipedia Edit Session (2015-08)
researchObject.abstract: This dataset contains a record for every "edit session" that occured on English Wikipedia up to Aug. 2015

provenance.narrative: This dataset was created by applying the edit session threshold described in Geiger, R. S., & Halfaker, A. (2013, February). Using edit sessions to measure participation in Wikipedia. In Proceedings of the 2013 conference on Computer supported cooperative work (pp. 861-870). ACM.  The 'sessionize' utility from https://pythonhosted.org/mwsessions/utilities.html was run against the entire chronological history of the English Wikipedia `revision` and `archive` tables.  These files are the result of that run.

publications: Geiger, R. S., & Halfaker, A. (2013, February). Using edit sessions to measure participation in Wikipedia. In Proceedings of the 2013 conference on Computer supported cooperative work (pp. 861-870). ACM.

Halfaker, A., Keyes, O., Kluver, D., Thebault-Spieker, J., Nguyen, T., Shores, K., ... & Warncke-Wang, M. (2015, May). User session identification based on strong regularities in inter-activity time. In Proceedings of the 24th International Conference on World Wide Web (pp. 410-418). International World Wide Web Conferences Steering Committee.

locations.comment: General discussion of the means and implications of measuring activity sessions.

files.creator: Aaron Halfaker <aaron.halfaker@gmail.com>
files.name: sessions.enwiki.2015-08
files.abstract: This file contains all of the edit sessions that occured in the history of English Wikipedia.  Each row represents a session.

files.creator: Aaron Halfaker <aaron.halfaker@gmail.com>
files.name: session_revisions.enwiki.2015-08
files.abstract: This file contains all of the edit revisions saved in the history of English Wikipedia with session annotations included.
